title: John Chapter 14 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 14 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 14 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 14.

questions.question: According to John 14:6, Jesus said He is the way, the truth, and the ______.
options: Life
Light
Word
Peace
questions.correctAnswer: Life
questions.explanation: John 14:6 states, 'Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life.'

questions.question: Who asked Jesus, 'Lord, we know not whither thou goest; and how can we know the way?'
options: Thomas
Philip
Judas
Peter
questions.correctAnswer: Thomas
questions.explanation: John 14:5 records Thomas asking Jesus about knowing the way.

questions.question: Where did Jesus say He was going to prepare a place for His followers?
options: In my Father's house
To the mountaintop
To the Garden of Gethsemane
To the temple
questions.correctAnswer: In my Father's house
questions.explanation: John 14:2 says, 'In my Father's house are many mansions: I go to prepare a place for you.'

questions.question: According to John 14:13, what will Jesus do if asked in His name?
options: He will do it
He will send an angel
He will speak through prophets
He will give a sign
questions.correctAnswer: He will do it
questions.explanation: John 14:13 states, 'And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do.'

questions.question: True or False: John 14:18 says Jesus will leave His followers comfortless.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 14:18 says, 'I will not leave you comfortless: I will come to you.'

questions.question: Who did Philip ask to show them the Father?
options: Jesus
Thomas
Judas
Peter
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:8 records Philip asking Jesus to show them the Father.

questions.question: What does Jesus say will happen to those who believe in Him according to John 14:12?
options: They will do greater works than He
They will become rich
They will live forever on earth
They will not face troubles
questions.correctAnswer: They will do greater works than He
questions.explanation: John 14:12 says believers will do the works Jesus does and greater works.

questions.question: Complete the verse from John 14:1: 'Let not your heart be ______: ye believe in God, believe also in me.'
options: troubled
fearful
weak
doubtful
questions.correctAnswer: troubled
questions.explanation: John 14:1 says, 'Let not your heart be troubled.'

questions.question: Who is the Comforter Jesus promised to send according to John 14:26?
options: The Holy Ghost
An angel
A prophet
John the Baptist
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Ghost
questions.explanation: John 14:26 describes the Comforter as the Holy Ghost sent by the Father.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that the world can receive the Spirit of truth because they see and know Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 14:17 states the world cannot receive the Spirit of truth because it sees Him not nor knows Him.

questions.question: According to John 14:23, what will happen if a man loves Jesus and keeps His words?
options: The Father and Jesus will come and make their abode with him
He will become a prophet
He will receive riches
He will be free from troubles
questions.correctAnswer: The Father and Jesus will come and make their abode with him
questions.explanation: John 14:23 says if a man loves Jesus and keeps His words, the Father and Jesus will dwell with him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from John 14:27: 'Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be ______.'
options: afraid
weak
sad
confused
questions.correctAnswer: afraid
questions.explanation: John 14:27 says, 'Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.'

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said that He would talk much more with His disciples after this chapter's events.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 14:30 says Jesus will not talk much more because the prince of this world is coming.

questions.question: Who said, 'Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?'
options: Judas, not Iscariot
Thomas
Philip
Peter
questions.correctAnswer: Judas, not Iscariot
questions.explanation: John 14:22 records Judas (not Iscariot) asking this question.

questions.question: According to John 14:16, what will the Father give to the disciples at Jesus' request?
options: Another Comforter
A new law
A prophet
Wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Another Comforter
questions.explanation: John 14:16 says Jesus will pray the Father to give another Comforter to abide forever.

medium.title: John Chapter 14 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 14 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is anxious about the future and feels troubled. Based on John 14, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their faith?
options: Believe in God and also believe in Jesus
Rely only on your own strength
Ignore your feelings of trouble
Avoid thinking about the future
questions.correctAnswer: Believe in God and also believe in Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:1 encourages believers not to let their hearts be troubled but to believe in God and Jesus, fostering trust and peace in uncertain times.

questions.question: How does John 14 teach us about the promise of eternal life and assurance for believers?
options: Jesus is preparing a place for us in His Father's house
We must earn our place by works alone
There is no certainty about the afterlife
Only angels dwell in the Father’s house
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is preparing a place for us in His Father's house
questions.explanation: John 14:2-3 assures believers that Jesus is going to prepare a place for them in His Father’s house, highlighting the certainty of eternal life.

questions.question: A believer struggles with doubt about how to approach God. According to John 14, what is the way to the Father?
options: Jesus is the way, the truth, and the life
Following human traditions
Relying on good deeds only
Seeking knowledge from many sources
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the way, the truth, and the life
questions.explanation: John 14:6 clearly states that Jesus is the only way to the Father, emphasizing faith in Him as essential for salvation and relationship with God.

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about the relationship between knowing Jesus and knowing God the Father?
options: Knowing Jesus means knowing the Father
Knowing Jesus is unrelated to knowing the Father
Only the Father is important to know
We can know the Father without Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing Jesus means knowing the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:7 and 14:9 explain that seeing and knowing Jesus is equivalent to seeing and knowing the Father, emphasizing their unity.

questions.question: A Christian wants to understand how Jesus and the Father work together. According to John 14, what is the nature of their relationship?
options: Jesus is in the Father, and the Father is in Jesus
Jesus acts independently from the Father
The Father does not work through Jesus
Jesus only speaks His own words
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is in the Father, and the Father is in Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:10-11 teaches that Jesus and the Father dwell in each other and that Jesus’ words and works are done through the Father’s power.

questions.question: How does John 14 encourage believers about the works they can do through faith in Jesus?
options: Believers will do greater works than Jesus because He goes to the Father
Believers cannot do any works
Only Jesus can do miracles
Believers should avoid doing works
questions.correctAnswer: Believers will do greater works than Jesus because He goes to the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:12 promises that those who believe in Jesus will do the works He did and even greater works, empowered by the Father.

questions.question: What does John 14 teach about praying in Jesus’ name and its effect?
options: Whatever is asked in Jesus’ name will be done to glorify the Father
Prayers in Jesus’ name are not effective
Only certain prayers will be answered
Prayer is not necessary
questions.correctAnswer: Whatever is asked in Jesus’ name will be done to glorify the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:13-14 states that asking anything in Jesus’ name will be done so the Father may be glorified in the Son, emphasizing faithful prayer.

questions.question: A believer wants to show love for Jesus practically. According to John 14, what is the way to demonstrate that love?
options: Keep His commandments
Attend church only
Give large offerings
Perform public acts of service
questions.correctAnswer: Keep His commandments
questions.explanation: John 14:15 and 14:21 teach that loving Jesus is shown by obedience to His commandments, linking love with faithful living.

questions.question: How does this passage encourage believers about the presence of the Holy Spirit in their lives?
options: The Holy Spirit, the Comforter, will abide with believers forever
The Holy Spirit is only for church leaders
The world can receive the Holy Spirit easily
The Holy Spirit will leave believers after trials
questions.correctAnswer: The Holy Spirit, the Comforter, will abide with believers forever
questions.explanation: John 14:16-17 promises the Holy Spirit as another Comforter who will remain with and in believers forever, providing guidance and peace.

questions.question: When believers face fear or trouble, what comfort does John 14 offer about Jesus’ presence?
options: Jesus will not leave them comfortless and will come to them
They must face troubles alone
Comfort comes only from other people
Troubles mean God has abandoned them
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus will not leave them comfortless and will come to them
questions.explanation: John 14:18 assures believers that Jesus will not leave them without comfort but will come to them, providing hope and presence in trials.

questions.question: How does John 14 instruct about the connection between love, obedience, and God’s love manifesting in believers?
options: Those who love Jesus keep His commandments and will be loved by the Father
Love alone is enough without obedience
Obedience is for fear, not love
God’s love is independent of human response
questions.correctAnswer: Those who love Jesus keep His commandments and will be loved by the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:21 and 14:23 teach that love for Jesus is shown by keeping His words, resulting in the Father’s love and God’s presence dwelling with believers.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 14, Jesus said that the word spoken to believers is His own, not the Father’s.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 14:24 clearly states that the words Jesus speaks are not His own but the Father’s who sent Him, emphasizing divine authority.

questions.question: True or False: The Holy Spirit is described in John 14 as the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive because it neither sees nor knows Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 14:17 describes the Holy Spirit as the Spirit of truth whom the world cannot receive because it does not see or know Him, but believers know Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, "Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be ________, neither let it be afraid."
options: troubled
joyful
proud
doubtful
questions.correctAnswer: troubled
questions.explanation: John 14:27 teaches believers to have peace from Jesus and not to let their hearts be troubled or afraid, encouraging calm and trust.

questions.question: According to John 14, why should believers rejoice when Jesus says He is going to the Father?
options: Because the Father is greater than Jesus
Because Jesus is leaving them forever
Because they will no longer see Jesus
Because they will be alone
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Father is greater than Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:28 teaches that believers should rejoice in Jesus’ going to the Father because the Father is greater, indicating the fulfillment of God's plan.

hard.title: John Chapter 14 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 14.

questions.question: In John 14:6, Jesus declares Himself as 'the way, the truth, and the life.' How does this statement relate to the Old Testament concept of God as the sole path to salvation?
options: It fulfills the exclusivity of Yahweh as the only God (Deuteronomy 6:4)
It contradicts the Old Testament's multiple paths to God
It introduces a new polytheistic belief
It denies the need for faith in God
questions.correctAnswer: It fulfills the exclusivity of Yahweh as the only God (Deuteronomy 6:4)
questions.explanation: John 14:6 highlights Jesus as the exclusive path to the Father, echoing Deuteronomy 6:4's declaration of Yahweh's uniqueness, affirming monotheism and salvation through God alone.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus stating in John 14:2 that 'In my Father's house are many mansions,' in light of ancient Jewish beliefs about the afterlife?
options: It affirms the existence of a prepared place for believers, contrasting with Sheol's shadowy afterlife
It denies any form of afterlife or resurrection
It suggests reincarnation according to Jewish tradition
It implies that the Father's house is a physical temple on earth
questions.correctAnswer: It affirms the existence of a prepared place for believers, contrasting with Sheol's shadowy afterlife
questions.explanation: Jesus' reference to 'many mansions' in John 14:2 communicates hope of a distinct, glorious dwelling place beyond Sheol, aligning with emerging Jewish eschatological ideas about resurrection and eternal life.

questions.question: Thomas questions Jesus in John 14:5 about knowing 'the way.' How does Jesus' response in John 14:6 reflect the Johannine theme of 'knowing' God through Jesus?
options: Jesus reveals Himself as the exclusive means of knowing and accessing the Father
Jesus admits that no one can know the way to the Father
Jesus redirects Thomas to follow the Law of Moses
Jesus says that the way is a secret only for the disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus reveals Himself as the exclusive means of knowing and accessing the Father
questions.explanation: In John 14:6, Jesus declares He is 'the way,' emphasizing the Johannine theme that intimate knowledge of God is mediated uniquely through Jesus Himself.

questions.question: How does the dialogue between Philip and Jesus in John 14:8-9 illustrate the concept of divine revelation through the incarnation?
options: Jesus states that seeing Him is equivalent to seeing the Father, revealing God incarnate
Philip is told to worship the Father alone and ignore Jesus
Jesus claims He is only a prophet, not God
Philip is asked to wait for a future revelation from Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus states that seeing Him is equivalent to seeing the Father, revealing God incarnate
questions.explanation: Jesus’ response in John 14:9 affirms the incarnation, showing that in Jesus’ person God is revealed fully, fulfilling Old Testament anticipations of God dwelling among His people.

questions.question: In John 14:16-17, Jesus promises 'another Comforter' who is 'the Spirit of truth.' How does this promise connect to the Old Testament's depiction of the Spirit of God?
options: It continues the theme of God's Spirit indwelling believers as seen in Isaiah's prophecy of the Spirit's work
It introduces a new divine entity unrelated to the Old Testament
It contradicts the Old Testament by denying the Spirit's presence
It refers only to an angelic messenger, not the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: It continues the theme of God's Spirit indwelling believers as seen in Isaiah's prophecy of the Spirit's work
questions.explanation: The 'Spirit of truth' promised in John 14:16-17 aligns with Old Testament images like Isaiah 11:2, where the Spirit of God empowers and guides His people, now promised as a continuing presence.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in John 14:6 where Jesus says, 'I am the way, the truth, and the life,' and what is its theological significance?
options: Triadic parallelism emphasizing Jesus’ comprehensive role in salvation
Simile comparing Jesus to a path
Metaphor implying that Jesus is a door
Alliteration to make the phrase memorable
questions.correctAnswer: Triadic parallelism emphasizing Jesus’ comprehensive role in salvation
questions.explanation: The triadic structure in John 14:6 uses parallelism to emphasize the totality of Jesus’ role in salvation as the path, reality, and source of eternal life.

questions.question: In John 14:12, Jesus states believers will do 'greater works' than He did. How might this statement relate to the New Testament theme of the Church's mission?
options: It foreshadows the Church's expansion and miraculous acts empowered by the Holy Spirit
It refers only to Jesus’ future miracles after resurrection
It is a mistranslation and means lesser works
It denies the possibility of miracles after Jesus’ ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows the Church's expansion and miraculous acts empowered by the Holy Spirit
questions.explanation: John 14:12 anticipates the empowered mission of the Church in Acts and beyond, performing signs through the Spirit's power, surpassing Jesus’ earthly ministry in scope.

questions.question: How does the promise of 'peace' in John 14:27 contrast with worldly peace, and what Old Testament peace concept does it echo?
options: It offers shalom, a holistic peace from God, unlike temporary worldly peace
It promises political peace through military conquest
It describes an absence of conflict due to military dominance
It emphasizes peace only in personal emotions, ignoring societal context
questions.correctAnswer: It offers shalom, a holistic peace from God, unlike temporary worldly peace
questions.explanation: John 14:27’s peace echoes the Hebrew 'shalom,' meaning completeness and well-being, contrasting with the transient and fragile peace of the world.

questions.question: In John 14:11, Jesus asks to believe 'for the very works' sake.' How does this relate to the Old Testament concept of God's actions as revelation of His identity?
options: It aligns with the Hebrew idea that God's deeds reveal His nature and covenant
It rejects the Old Testament emphasis on God's deeds
It suggests that words are more important than works
It implies that faith should be blind, without evidence
questions.correctAnswer: It aligns with the Hebrew idea that God's deeds reveal His nature and covenant
questions.explanation: John 14:11 reflects the Old Testament principle where God’s mighty acts (e.g., Exodus) reveal His character and invite faith, reinforcing Jesus' divine identity.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus stating in John 14:28 'For my Father is greater than I' in the context of first-century Jewish monotheism and Johannine theology?
options: It expresses the Son’s voluntary submission within the divine economy without denying unity
It denies Jesus’ divinity and makes Him inferior God
It introduces polytheism
It is a later addition contradicting the rest of John
questions.correctAnswer: It expresses the Son’s voluntary submission within the divine economy without denying unity
questions.explanation: John 14:28 reflects the paradox of Jesus’ incarnate humility and submission to the Father, consistent with monotheism and Johannine emphasis on relational unity.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 14:26, the Comforter (Holy Ghost) will teach the disciples all things and remind them of Jesus' teachings.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 14:26 clearly states the Holy Ghost will teach all things and bring remembrance of Jesus' words to the disciples.

questions.question: In John 14:23, Jesus says that if a person loves Him, He and the Father will 'make our abode' with him. What Old Testament concept does this echo about God's presence?
options: It echoes God dwelling among His people, like in the Tabernacle and Temple
It introduces an entirely new idea of God's presence
It contradicts the notion of God's transcendence
It refers to a physical house to be built on earth
questions.correctAnswer: It echoes God dwelling among His people, like in the Tabernacle and Temple
questions.explanation: This promise in John 14:23 recalls God's presence dwelling among Israel in the Tabernacle and Temple, now internalized in believers.

questions.question: How does Jesus' promise in John 14:18, 'I will not leave you comfortless,' serve as a foreshadowing of the resurrection and Pentecost events?
options: It foreshadows His resurrection and the coming of the Holy Spirit as Comforter
It only refers to Jesus' physical presence before crucifixion
It denies any future comfort after His departure
It predicts the destruction of the Temple
questions.correctAnswer: It foreshadows His resurrection and the coming of the Holy Spirit as Comforter
questions.explanation: John 14:18 anticipates Jesus' resurrection and the Pentecost outpouring of the Spirit, ensuring believers are not abandoned.

questions.question: In John 14:7, Jesus says, 'If ye had known me, ye should have known my Father also.' How does this statement reflect the Johannine theme of Jesus as the revelation of God?
options: It shows Jesus as the visible manifestation of the invisible God
It separates Jesus from God as unrelated beings
It denies any knowledge of God through Jesus
It means Jesus is only a teacher, not God
questions.correctAnswer: It shows Jesus as the visible manifestation of the invisible God
questions.explanation: This verse reflects the Johannine theme that Jesus reveals the Father fully, bridging the divine and human knowledge of God.

questions.question: What is the authorial intent behind Jesus' repeated emphasis on 'belief' and 'love' in John 14:1, 15, 21, and 23?
options: To stress relational faithfulness as the basis for abiding in God and receiving divine presence
To impose legalistic observance of rituals
To encourage doubt and skepticism
To promote political loyalty to Jewish leaders
questions.correctAnswer: To stress relational faithfulness as the basis for abiding in God and receiving divine presence
questions.explanation: The repeated theme underlines that true faith is relational and expressed in love and obedience, which leads to intimate communion with God.

theological.title: John Chapter 14 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 14 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to John 14, what is the significance of Jesus' statement 'I am the way, the truth, and the life'?
options: Jesus is the exclusive path to the Father
Jesus is a prophet among many ways
Jesus offers a philosophy of life
Jesus is a moral teacher only
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the exclusive path to the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:6 states explicitly that no one comes to the Father except through Jesus, affirming His unique role in salvation. This exclusivity is consistent with Old Testament revelation that God alone provides the path to Himself (Isaiah 35:8; Psalm 25:4-5) and New Testament teachings on salvation through Christ (Acts 4:12; 1 Timothy 2:5).

questions.question: What does Jesus promise to do for the disciples in His Father's house?
options: Prepare a place for them
Give them earthly kingdoms
Teach them new laws
Bring them food
questions.correctAnswer: Prepare a place for them
questions.explanation: John 14:2 shows Jesus going to prepare a place for His followers in the Father's house, symbolizing eternal dwelling with God. This echoes the biblical hope of a future heavenly home (Hebrews 11:16; Revelation 21:2-3) where God and His people will be united forever (Psalm 23:6; 2 Corinthians 5:1).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the relationship between Himself and the Father in John 14?
options: He is in the Father, and the Father is in Him
He is separate and independent from the Father
He is a servant of the Father with no unity
He is a created being of the Father
questions.correctAnswer: He is in the Father, and the Father is in Him
questions.explanation: John 14:10-11 reveals the mutual indwelling of Jesus and the Father, emphasizing their unity and shared divine nature. This profound Christological truth aligns with Old Testament affirmations of God's oneness (Deuteronomy 6:4) and New Testament teachings of the divine nature of Christ (Colossians 2:9; Hebrews 1:3).

questions.question: What role does the 'Comforter' or 'Spirit of truth' have according to John 14?
options: To teach and remind the disciples of Jesus' teachings
To judge the world immediately
To replace Jesus physically
To reveal new scriptures
questions.correctAnswer: To teach and remind the disciples of Jesus' teachings
questions.explanation: John 14:26 explains that the Comforter, the Holy Spirit, will teach all things and bring to remembrance Jesus' words. This role as teacher and guide is consistent with Old Testament promise of the Spirit (Isaiah 11:2; Ezekiel 36:27) and New Testament fulfillment where the Spirit empowers believers (Acts 1:8; Romans 8:14).

questions.question: According to John 14, what is the condition for Jesus to manifest Himself to a person?
options: That person must love Jesus and keep His commandments
That person must perform miracles
That person must attend synagogue regularly
That person must renounce all possessions
questions.correctAnswer: That person must love Jesus and keep His commandments
questions.explanation: John 14:21 and 14:23 teach that loving Jesus and obeying His commandments results in Jesus manifesting Himself to the believer, highlighting the relational nature of salvation. This is in harmony with Old Testament emphasis on loving God and obedience (Deuteronomy 6:5; Psalm 119:2) and New Testament teachings on faith and works (James 2:18; 1 John 2:3-6).

questions.question: In John 14, Jesus promises that those who believe in Him will do what kind of works?
options: He will do the works, and they will do greater works
They will do fewer works to avoid sin
They will only do charitable works
They will not do any works
questions.correctAnswer: He will do the works, and they will do greater works
questions.explanation: John 14:12 states that believers will do the works Jesus does and even greater works because He goes to the Father. This promise reflects the empowerment by the Spirit for mission (Acts 1:8), fulfilling the Great Commission (Matthew 28:18-20) and continuing God's redemptive work (Isaiah 61:1-3).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about peace in John 14:27?
options: He gives a peace unlike the world’s peace
He gives peace only after death
He does not give peace but commands it
He gives peace only to the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: He gives a peace unlike the world’s peace
questions.explanation: John 14:27 records Jesus giving His peace, which is distinct from worldly peace, offering assurance and freedom from fear. This peace reflects the biblical concept of shalom (Isaiah 9:6; Philippians 4:7) and the inner tranquility granted by God’s presence (Psalm 29:11; Colossians 3:15).

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus saying 'I go to prepare a place for you' in light of biblical eschatology?
options: It means Jesus is preparing believers for eternal life with God
He is building physical houses on earth
He is preparing a new law for the people
He is leaving permanently without return
questions.correctAnswer: It means Jesus is preparing believers for eternal life with God
questions.explanation: John 14:2-3 indicates Jesus’ departure is to prepare a heavenly dwelling for believers, which points to the Christian hope of resurrection and eternal life (1 Corinthians 15:50-58; Revelation 21:1-4). This reflects God’s promise of restoration after the fall (Genesis 3:15) and the new creation (Isaiah 65:17).

questions.question: How does Jesus respond to Philip’s request to 'show us the Father'?
options: He says whoever has seen Him has seen the Father
He says the Father cannot be seen by anyone
He says He will send an angel to show the Father
He says the Father is hidden forever
questions.correctAnswer: He says whoever has seen Him has seen the Father
questions.explanation: John 14:9 reveals Jesus' unity with the Father by stating that seeing Jesus is equivalent to seeing the Father, affirming His divine nature and the incarnation. This is consistent with Old Testament theophanies (Exodus 33:20-23) and New Testament affirmations of Christ’s deity (Hebrews 1:3; Colossians 1:15).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about asking in His name according to John 14?
options: Whatever is asked in His name will be done
Asking in His name is discouraged
Only certain prayers in His name will be answered
Asking in His name requires offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Whatever is asked in His name will be done
questions.explanation: John 14:13-14 promises that requests made in Jesus' name will be granted so that the Father may be glorified. This accords with the biblical principle of prayer in Jesus’ authority (1 John 5:14; James 4:3) and the purpose of glorifying God through answered prayer (Psalm 50:15).

questions.question: According to John 14, why does the world not receive the Spirit of truth?
options: Because it neither sees Him nor knows Him
Because it rejects all spiritual things
Because the Spirit only appears to the Jews
Because the Spirit is only for the Old Testament saints
questions.correctAnswer: Because it neither sees Him nor knows Him
questions.explanation: John 14:17 explains the world cannot receive the Spirit of truth because it does not see or know Him, highlighting spiritual blindness and unbelief. This reflects themes in Isaiah 6:9-10 and 2 Corinthians 4:4 about the hardness of heart and blindness to God’s revelation.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the world’s power over Him in John 14:30?
options: The prince of the world has nothing in Him
The world fully controls Him
He is afraid of the world’s prince
He will overthrow the world by force
questions.correctAnswer: The prince of the world has nothing in Him
questions.explanation: John 14:30 asserts that the prince of this world (Satan) has no hold over Jesus, affirming His sinlessness and divine authority (Hebrews 4:15; 1 John 3:5). This confirms Jesus’ victory over evil (Colossians 2:15) in the cosmic conflict (Ephesians 6:12).

questions.question: What does Jesus say will happen 'at that day' in John 14:20?
options: Believers will know that Jesus is in the Father, and they are in Jesus
The world will be destroyed
All believers will perform miracles
Jesus will establish a political kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Believers will know that Jesus is in the Father, and they are in Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:20 describes the spiritual reality of union with Christ and the Father that believers will understand fully in the eschatological day, consistent with the New Testament teaching on mystical union (Romans 8:10; Galatians 2:20) and ultimate revelation (1 Corinthians 13:12).

questions.question: What is the basis for Jesus’ claim that His words are not His own but the Father’s who dwells in Him?
options: Because the Father is working through Him
Because He is quoting human teachers
Because He is unsure of His message
Because He wants to avoid responsibility
questions.correctAnswer: Because the Father is working through Him
questions.explanation: John 14:10 explains that Jesus speaks the words of the Father because the Father dwells in Him and does the works, emphasizing divine agency and unity. This aligns with Old Testament theophanies where God speaks through His servant (Isaiah 61:1) and New Testament affirmations of Jesus’ divine mission (John 5:19; Hebrews 1:2).

questions.question: According to Jesus in John 14, why should believers not let their hearts be troubled or afraid?
options: Because they believe in God and in Jesus
Because troubles will never come
Because they have perfect knowledge
Because fear is sinful
questions.correctAnswer: Because they believe in God and in Jesus
questions.explanation: John 14:1 and 14:27 encourage believers not to be troubled or afraid due to their faith in God and Jesus, offering peace and confidence rooted in divine promises. This reflects Old Testament exhortations to trust God (Psalm 56:3; Isaiah 41:10) and New Testament assurances of God’s peace (Philippians 4:6-7).
